fields.description:
In the new view for *Portfolio*, the roadmap is missing the issue detail view displayed in the old view. This is restricting the user to be able to link issues and see descriptions on the same page.

!image-2020-10-15-16-47-43-062.png|width=1024,height=314!
fields.summary: Portfolio 2.0 view to include issue detail view

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to see the sprint estimations instead of team capacity in advanced roadmaps Sprint information.
When grouping the issues by Teams and displaying the sprints, it shows the team capacity inside the Sprint and not the Sprint total capacity vs team capacity.
 !image-2020-10-15-17-14-01-685.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to see the sprint estimations instead of team capacity in advanced roadmaps Sprint information

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When editing the Issue Source from any Plan, the ‘Issues Without Parent Epics’ checkbox will be always ticked, even if you uncheck it and saved this configuration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or Edit a Plan 
# Go to the “Confirm what’s in scope” section 
# Uncheck the ‘Issues Without Parent Epics’ box.
# Save
# Go back to edit the Issue Source once again and you'll see the 'Issues Without Parent Epics’ box ticked.

h3. Expected Results
'Issues Without Parent Epics’ box is unchecked

h3. Actual Results
'Issues Without Parent Epics’ box is ticked

h3. Workaround
Uncheck the checkbox and Save it again if you notice new issues not covered by epics appearing on your plan
fields.summary: ‘Issues Without Parent Epics’ checkbox is always ticked in “Confirm what’s in scope” section

fields.description: Issues created via automation appear at the bottom of the backlog. It's a major pain in the ass to have to move them to the board, but it's also messing up our team's workflow b/c "out of sight, out of mind." When I create an action, I want to be able to specify if new issues are created on the Board or in the Backlog.
fields.summary: I want Automation to create new issues on the Board (not the Backlog) in next-gen projects.

fields.description:
When adding an issue to a sprint, the dropdown list of sprints always had the most relevant sprint at the top (active sprint for issue's project).

This functionality seems to have disappeared. Would be nice to have back. 

!Screen Shot 2019-08-08 at 2.32.40 PM.png|width=910,height=400!
fields.summary: Suggest most relevant/active sprints first when creating issue

fields.description:
The new issue view no longer sums up the Story Points from Sub-tasks into Parent issue.

When using the old view, if you have sub-tasks estimated, it sums up to the Parent Link to display the amount of work that has been estimated. The new issue view no longer presents this feature.
It forces the customers to roll back to the old UI for Jira Software users.
fields.summary: New issue view no longer sum up the Story Points from Sub-tasks into Parent issue

fields.description:
*Suggestions* and *All epics* are missing in the Epic link dropdown on the new issue view when trying to link an Epic to an issue.

*Old issue view*
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-11 at 10.49.06.png|thumbnail!

*New issue view*
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-11 at 10.49.51.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*
 * Open the issue outside the board or disable the new Jira issue view in *Personal settings*.
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-11 at 10.51.33.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show "Suggestions" and "All epics" are missing for Epic link field on new Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A next-gen board appears in a classic project. The board doesn't load and an error message is shown.

!image-2020-10-15-09-33-01-858.png|width=505,height=353!
h3. Steps to Reproduce

n/a
h3. Expected Results

Next-gen boards should not be in classic projects.

And vice versa, classic boards should not be in next-gen projects.
h3. Actual Results

Next-gen boards appear in classic projects.

If you encounter this problem please contact support at https://support.atlassian.com/contact
fields.summary: Next-gen boards in classic projects

fields.description:
When you use a custom field text multi-line clear value post function, the history record from the issue shows strange values like the clod ID and the custom field ID in the old issue view.

This data should not be displayed on the history content.
 !image-2020-10-14-14-29-16-137.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-10-14-14-29-43-710.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-10-14-14-30-43-618.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Custom field text multi-line clear value post function recording strange data in the issue history

fields.description: It would be awesome the possibility to share automatically all dashboards with a group like a bulk option.
fields.summary: Automatically share dashboards with a group

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Days Remaining in Sprint gadget fails to redirect to the Board when using the Sprint link if the *Next Sprint Due (auto)* parameter is used.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a dashboard and add the Days Remaining in Sprint gadget;
# Select a Board and when selecting the Sprint use the *Next Sprint Due (auto)*;
# Select the Show Sprint Name option;
# Click on the Sprint name in the gadget.

Gadget set up example:
!Image 2020-10-07 at 12.38.53 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The Sprint will be properly loaded on the board.

h3. Actual Results

The following URL will be used and the board will open with a blank page.
{code}secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=<BOARD_ID>&sprint=auto&useStoredSettings=true{code}

h3. Workaround

Manually select the desired Sprint in the gadget configuration.
fields.summary: Days Remaining in Sprint gadget fails to redirect to the Board when using the Sprint link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Mac Native app fails using macOs Big Sur
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to login using macOS Big Sur

h3. Expected Results
Login successfully 
h3. Actual Results
Ending loop to login again

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Mac Native app fails using macOs Big Sur

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Display Reports into new planning interface for advance roadmaps, as is displayed into the old interface
fields.summary: Display Reports into new planning interface for advance roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Advanced Roadmaps plan includes more issues than selected during plan creation

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 3 issues and close one
# Create a filter that returns the 3
 # Create plan
 # Select 1 issue
# Load the plan and the issue completed will be displayed without being selected

h3. Expected Results
Only selected issues are displayed
 
h3. Actual Results
Done issues are not displayed during plan creation and so they are not excluded.

h3. Workaround
Update the plan to not display done issues or update the plan's filter to exclude the same.
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps plan includes more issues than selected during plan creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we open a project by default we will be redirected to the board. We should be able to change this because sometimes the customer prefers to be redirected to the backlog.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a project.
 # You will be redirected to the board.

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to adjust the default redirection.

h3. Actual Results
We cannot change the default redirection.

h3. Workaround
We can save the backlog as a favorite into the browser.
fields.summary: We should be able to change the default board redirect when we open a project

fields.description:
Currently, it is only possible to share a link with users that already have access to the plan, but in Server, there are other options to share a plan with external users: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/sharing-and-exporting-plan-data-960719459.html

It would be great to have these options in Cloud.
fields.summary: Enhance the sharing options for Advanced Roadmap Cloud without consuming user license

fields.description:
For Jira Server, there is an app that allows sharing the Plan in Confluence. It would be good having the same solution in Cloud.
The app is listed [here|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1221237/advanced-roadmaps-for-jira-in-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview]
fields.summary: Create an app for Advanced Roadmaps for Jira in Confluence as it exists for Jira Server Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
What we are expecting is to be able to use the RoadMap feature inside a project where a multi-project-KanBan is set.
As of now, RoadMap works only when we have a project with a Kanban that shows the issue belonging to one  project .
 
For example, here I have a project DSEE and you can see its Kanban configuration:
!https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0?ui=2&ik=8e8d15042e&attid=0.1&permmsgid=msg-a:r8850731261060605302&th=17521806b15540f3&view=fimg&sz=s0-l75-ft&attbid=ANGjdJ9amWgLEfu7uZw1FAZ0jDYO8UO7uBvqp_v0GO4yFjzlZ2f0JDP8aByjk8_u8fXjFD9man7DQBfF1tHHXPvrGb9TEpGz6_lOyqyPqRVzQyDucsTLb0LGRlSpGAU&disp=emb&realattid=ii_kg7t6qhd0|width=562,height=348!
This Kanban board brings to the board the issues from 5 differents projects (dispatched throughout swimlanes):
!https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0?ui=2&ik=8e8d15042e&attid=0.2&permmsgid=msg-a:r8850731261060605302&th=17521806b15540f3&view=fimg&sz=s0-l75-ft&attbid=ANGjdJ_1iwJFESB2svpM8gNFIBn67j25zt46qhSMOImQ6WQ7MGFbCqJg4ozWAwDfyNBV_xRbjmbX9qhFbdseIsAblBiohMShWj07s1RVHgWRQK5vHbdkMx7llyQUj8A&disp=emb&realattid=ii_kg7t81iz1|width=562,height=182!
 
 
Unfortunately the RoadMap feature is disabled (it says its available when a kanban filter brings issues from only one project):
!https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0?ui=2&ik=8e8d15042e&attid=0.3&permmsgid=msg-a:r8850731261060605302&th=17521806b15540f3&view=fimg&sz=s0-l75-ft&attbid=ANGjdJ9JRv4lqR98c3H73Ir90S0J2ShQz6-RmTWPBpBXRlN8PHGLdZP3ZuZa_9kNTPookoBwKxYOdqWr_Evx-MS9RCdsf_lK5yDvctc2kDZolAY4priMS5ykfds6dlI&disp=emb&realattid=ii_kg7tbnuw2|width=562,height=287!
 
It would be  great to have RoadMap showing issues grouped by Epic and Projects.
Project grouping could be shown alike swimlanes inside which we see issues grouped by Epics(the current way it works).
 
We really look forward to having RoadMap available for such situations because we intensively use RoadMap in other cases and our users are used to have this kind of UI when create issues.
 
Do not hesitate for more details if my explanation is not clear enough.
 
Kind regards.
 
Sergueï T
PMO Véolia France (SADE)
fields.summary: Use a RoadMap feature when Kanban shows issues from multiple projects

fields.description: As a user, I'd like to be able to customize the icons of Components/Labels when grouping the issues. This would enhance the experience with the plans and assist in identifying quickly the labels and components while using the plans.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to customize the icons of Components/Labels when grouping the issues

fields.description:
Due to recent changes, we have observed that JQL is now fetching the custom field type along with the query and makes the JQL very difficult to read. 

For example: 
* Using a JQL for *CEO = currentUser()* (where CEO is a custom field)

After the recent changes, the JQL looks like below
*CEO[User Picker (single user)]" in (currentUser())*

Please improve this functionality in JQL.
fields.summary: Improve the JQL functions.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sprint board keeps loading forever when accessed by clicking on the sprint name from “Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget” in dashboard
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure you have an active sprint in one of the projects.
 # Add gadget "Days remaining in sprint" to your dashboard.
 # Ensure to check the boxes for Sprint Name and board Name   !image-2020-10-12-15-24-37-253.png|width=299,height=52!
 # Click on Save
 # Click on the Sprint Name -> it will route to the URL similar to below : [https://sitename.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=37&sprint=auto&useStoredSettings=true]

I have captured the behaviour in the gif below with the workaround:

!sprint_gadget.gif|width=531,height=255!
h3. Expected Results

The board should be visible with all the issues in it.
h3. Actual Results

!image-2020-10-12-15-27-14-429.png|width=259,height=135!
h3. Workaround

Remove the trailing {color:#00875a}+*&sprint=auto*+{color} from the URL, then the page loads fine.
fields.summary: Sprint board keeps loading forever when accessed by clicking on the sprint name from “Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget” in dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sprint Suggestion list showing sprints from across the instance, instead of board/project-local sprints
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create an issue 
 # open the issue 
# Under 'Sprint' field - click to select the sprint name 
  
h3. Expected Results
User to be presented with the list of active sprints in the current board 

h3. Actual Results
User is presented with the current list of all active sprints to select from

h3. Workaround
User to start typing to filter for the relevant sprint
fields.summary: Sprint Suggestion list showing sprints from across the instance, instead of board/project-local sprints

fields.description: When an application link to to Crucible is present, the old issue view displays a link to 'Create review for all commits'. This link is absent from the new issue view when viewing commit details for an issue.
fields.summary: Crucible 'Create review for all commits' link not Visible in New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Classic project notifications can be configured to be sent to single emails, it would be helpful to have this option on Next-gen.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add support for adding single e-mails/users to Next-Gen notifications
h3. Why this is important

Customers using Next-gen projects would like to configure single users to receive notifications on various events. 
h4.
fields.summary: Add Next-gen notifications configuration for single emails

fields.description:
Hello

for the next gen projects, we want to be able to customize the user list with the team members working on the project (customize the actual user list).

Currently this is not possible:

!image-2020-10-12-18-59-23-608.png!
fields.summary: Customize user picker option

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The PUT /rest/agile/1.0/board/\{boardId}/properties/\{propertyKey} REST API does not indicate the permissions required to successfully call the API.

For context, also see https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/are-there-any-specific-rights-needed-to-put-a-property-on-an-agile-board-object/42009.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Read the documentation of the set board property API by visiting [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/api-group-board]

h3. Expected Results

The documentation indicates the permissions required to successfully call the API.
h3. Actual Results

The documentation does not detail the permissions required to successfully call the API.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Permissions not specified for set board property API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

By having a pending change, specifically, a *Create issue* event in your Plan that's linked to an archived Project, attempting to *Review changes* will cause it to break and get a "*Something's gone wrong*" error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Plan and 2 Projects (JPO1 and JPO2)
# Add JPO1 and JPO2 to the Issue sources
# In the Plan, create an Issue for JPO2 directly in the scope view
# Make additional random changes to issues from JPO1 in the scope view
# Archive the JPO2 Project
# Head back to the Plan and *Review changes*

h3. Expected Results

The changes in creating a new issue should either be committed or automatically discarded since the Project is archived.

h3. Actual Results

You get an error when clicking on *Review changes*
 !Synology_2021_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Get the list of impacted projects using the Development panel: 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
You must discard the pending change by first un-archiving the Project in question, manually discard the change from the *Review changes* dialogue then save changes. Once done you can archive the Project again.
fields.summary: Pending changes from an archived project breaks the Plan

fields.description:
At the moment, Roadmaps doesn't include,
* Issues that were marked as Done over a year ago.
* Issues that were resolved with a due date from over a year ago.

Provide the ability to users/add an option to view issues that were done over a year ago so that users could check/uncheck the option to view issues closed over a year ago.
fields.summary: Ability to view issues closed over a year ago in classic roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When configuring the Issue sources in the *Confirm what's in scope* step, there is no issue count that displays how many Issues have been selected out of a total to indicate if all Issues have been selected.

You only get a count of how many issues have been selected and you only know if everything hasn't been selected by the highlighting of the *Select all* button, giving you no overview of what's hidden without manually going through nested issues.

 !select_all.png|thumbnail! 

Some additional key required key improvements:

* There is no indication of how many issues in the Done category status are not being displayed
* There is no indication that the total count being displayed is specific to that Issue level and not all issues in the source
* There is no indication that display count of open Sub-Task issues being excluded due to their parent being in a Done status

h3. Propose solution

There should be an issue count that indicates both the total amount and the select amount to clearly know what's hidden along with additional information such as Issues in a Done category status or Issue level count.

 !34_out_of_57.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Confirm what's in scope issue selection step improvement

fields.description: Would it be possible to implement the ability to fold / unfold all comments at once on a Jira ticket, with the "new view"?
fields.summary: Comment displaying

fields.description:
It would be useful if the error message said something more about the screen it's looking for.
{code}{"issues":[],"errors":[{"status":400,"elementErrors":{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"customfield_10011":"Field 'customfield_10011' cannot be set. It is not on the appropriate screen, or unknown."}},"failedElementNumber":0}]} {code}
fields.summary: Error message should provide more/relevant information about the screens(names)

fields.description:
The Advanced Roadmap release tracking warning does not work properly when velocity is derived via _issue count_,

it would be useful to be able to disable the warning so that correct information about releases is shared
fields.summary: Ability to disable Advanced Roadmap "Off Track" warning on releases

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue count does not appear in the board container header when Sprint feature is disabled in next-gen projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a next-gen project using kanban template (or disable Sprint feature in the features page)
 # Make sure backlog is enabled in features page
 # Go to the backlog page
 # Look at the board container header

h3. Expected Results

The issue count should be appearing on the top left part of the board container header (just like if Sprint was enabled)

Example below is for Sprint enabled project.

!image-2020-10-02-10-57-09-129.png!
h3. Actual Results

There is no issue count appearing on the top left part of the board container header.

!image-2020-10-02-10-58-40-924.png!
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Issue count does not appear in board container header when Sprint feature is disabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We are not seeing the "Link Confluence page" option from the "Link issue"  drop-down menu, when we try to access the sub-task via Project>Board>Issue>Subtask.

However, the "Link confluence page" option is visible when the subtask is opened via board directly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Atlassian site and access Jira Core Classic software project
 # Open an issue with the subtasks.
 # Click on one of the subtask link
 # When you try clicking the "Link Page" drop-down, you will not see "Link Confluence page" option.
 # When you access board again and try accessing the subtask directly (not via main issue), the "Link Confluence page" is visible.

h3. Expected Results

The "Link Confluence page" option should be available from all subtask board.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
Confluence link option is made visible{noformat}
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot link Confluence page to Subtask

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Having a board with a filter with ORDER BY Rank ASC only will cause the plan to not return any issue

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a filter with the condition
{code}
ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}
# Create a board using this filter
# Create a plan and use this board as issue source

h3. Expected Results
All the issues should be returned in the plan or at the issue selection step

h3. Actual Results
The plan doesn't identify any issue

h3. Workaround
Consider using filter conditions to specify the issues that will be returned from the filter query
fields.summary: Having a board with a filter with ORDER BY Rank ASC only will cause the plan to not return any issue

fields.description:
I would like to see User Defined Time Tracking Categories introduced into the Jira Time tracking feature and by extension visibility of this in Roadmaps / Advanced Roadmaps (Portfolio).

This way a ticket for a change request can track time spent towards the different types of activity:
R&D, BA, DEV, QA, UAT, DEPLOY, etc....

Right now as a workaround we have to create additional tickets by type of activity to get around the time tracking limitation.
fields.summary: User Defined Time Tracking Categories

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a kanban board, when you are transitioning a ticket from one column to another, and then with a single click when you try to open the ticket in the sidebar, it didn’t open, however with a 3rd click, the issues get opened in the sidebar. I am attaching a quick video demonstrating the same behavior.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a Kanban board and transition a ticket from one column to another.
 # After transitioning, open the ticket in the sidebar.

h3. Expected Results

Ticket will open in the sidebar with a single click
h3. Actual Results

After transitioning the ticket, it should open in the sidebar with a single click
h3. Workaround

The possible workaround at the moment is to refresh the page.
fields.summary: Opening a jira ticket after transitioning in Kanban sidebar,fails to open with a single click
Advanced Roadmaps fields (Team, Parent Link) don't show up in Automation For Jira

fields.description:
Hi Team

The updated made on Jira Service Desk Cloud it does not seem an improvement, at least in the session where you see the request types and categories.
Before we were able to see all the request type inside one Category and see what issue types they were using and we would be able to click on the request type and open its configuration.

Now the request type page is just a pile of request types that does no show neither their categories nor their issue type and once we go to the page that shows what is their categories we can't click on the request type to update it, we have to go back and search the request type on the pile to be able to update it.

It is not productive at all.
fields.summary: Update Feedback

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After linking a page to a Sprint, the page count is not updated. It always show 0.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Board > Backlog
# Attempt to link a Confluence page to the sprint as per [Link a Confluence page to a sprint|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/link-a-confluence-page-to-a-sprint/]

h3. Expected Results
The count on "Linked page" should be updated.

h3. Actual Results
The count on "Linked page" should be not updated. It always show 0, no matter how many pages are linked.
 !image-2020-10-07-11-09-24-323.png|thumbnail!  !image-2020-10-07-11-10-04-766.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: After linking a page to a sprint, the count is not updated.

fields.description:
As a user, I want to be able to find out how many days a given card has been in a column in a next-gen project, so that I can identify slow-moving issues. 

Currently this can be done in Classic projects (see image  !image-2020-10-07-10-54-00-481.png|thumbnail! ) under Board Settings > Card layout. I wish to have this feature in next-gen projects as well.
fields.summary: Days in column

fields.description:
It would be awesome to have the possibility to give for a new custom role the *create version* permission.

For the time being, it's included only on the *Administrator* role but it covers other undesired permissions for the same user.
fields.summary: Create version permission on custom roles

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the project has a hash "#" in the name the Workload Pie Chart Report does not open.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Put a hash "#" in a project's name
 # Try to open the Workload Pie Chart Report

h3. Expected Results
The report should open normally

h3. Actual Results
The page does not load


h3. Workaround
Remove the hash "#" from the project name
fields.summary: Using number sign/hash "#" in the project name makes Workload Pie Chart Report to not load

fields.description:
By now, even though a project is set as public, it's not possible to vote on an issue as also add yourself as a watcher if you don't log in.

The user may check the name of who has voted, but it's not possible to vote. If you try to add your email to watch the issue, an error message is shown:

!image-2020-10-06-11-30-44-787.png|width=325,height=131!
fields.summary: Allow not logged-in users to vote and watch issues in public projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Next-gen projects have quick filter that let you filter by issues assigned to yourself. 

But, differently from Classic projects, currently, the filters do not persist when navigating between the Backlog and the board view. 

See the recording:  [^Quick filter behaviour.mp4] 

h3. Suggestion

Make the Next-gen quick filters persist so the user does not need to apply it every time they navigate back and forth.
fields.summary: Next-gen quick filters should persist

fields.description:
Moving issues is really clunky and time consuming.

I would really like the ability to move issues with drag and drop.

For instance I may have created a task and then decided it should actually be a sub-task of another existing task or story. I'd like to be able to just drag it onto the other issue and have it be adopted as a sub-task.

On the other hand, I may have created an issue as a sub-task but decide it should really be a task or a story. I'd like to be able to drag it out on its own. This is not as important because I could just change the issue type. However, this should be a one step process and the progress dialog should only display if the process is going to take longer than, say, five seconds.

The feature would also be useful for moving issues between related projects.
fields.summary: Move issues with drag and drop

fields.description: Sometimes filters and dashboards number increases a lot and makes it difficult to manage them on the filters page, it would be helpful to have a feature or gadget that shows how many times a filter is being used and when.
fields.summary: Add a feature that indicates the filter and dashboard usage

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Print cards options in the Jira backlog are not working. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Jira Software Backlog.
# Select the print card options from the three dots. 

A new page opens with the list and has options card size and select. These options don’t work and cannot be clicked. The blue *print* button doesn't work either. 

h3. Expected Results

These buttons should be accessible to select the card size. 

h3. Actual Results

Options are not functioning. 

h3. Workaround
 Use File > Print, to print the cards as the 'print' button is unresponsive.
fields.summary: Print cards options in Jira backlog are not working.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In its current state, the timeline does not take into account Sub-tasks estimates for team capacity and the capacity estimation is only done on *story level* issues and higher.

This makes it problematic to use the capacity planning when estimating Sub-tasks in your work.

 !TST7_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

Include Sub-tasks estimates in the capacity planning for better and more precise forecasting.
fields.summary: Team capacity for Sub-tasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Investigate Default System Priority not pulling through for team-managed (formerly next-gen) Project
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Associate the Priority field in team-managed (formerly next-gen) issue screen
 # Investigation shows the default value picked for the Priority field is "Middle" value in all the options if the default value is not set in case of team-managed (formerly next-gen) issue.

h3. Expected Results
h3. Investigate how the default System Priority is getting set for the team-managed (formerly next-gen) project when the default is not set.
h3. Workaround

#Set default System Priority for team-managed (formerly next-gen) issues.
fields.summary: Investigate Default System Priority not pulling through for team-managed (formerly next-gen) Project

fields.description:
In old Jira when we create Sub-Tasks there is one popup window appear where we can edit/put all the fields (Example: Name, Description, Estimation etc.) at once.

In New Jira, it's not possible.
fields.summary: Sub-Task Editing Feature in New Jira Not Available

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
By default, Advanced Roadmaps have a schedule of 8h/day. If a team has decided to for for 6h/day, Advanced Roadmaps will still convert estimation into days based on a 8h per day basis: A task that has been estimated by a team with 5d (30h) in JIRA is being turned into 3.75d.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users setting working hours on plan level / Advanced roadmaps

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Allow users settings working hours on Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the shortcuts G+A or G+H, instead of redirect to the recently visited agile board, it shows a 404 page or a white page with the error "We can't find the page you're looking for".
 [Using Keyboard Shortcuts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile066/jira-agile-user-s-guide/using-keyboard-shortcuts] 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a dashboard, type G+A or G+H.

h3. Expected Results

It will redirect to the last viewed agile board.
h3. Actual Results

It redirects to a 404 page.

!Screen Shot 2020-10-01 at 16.41.39.png|width=503,height=306!

!Screen Shot 2020-10-01 at 16.41.17.png|width=527,height=484!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Shortcuts G+A and G+H redirects to a 404 page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Time tracking, working hours per day is not respected by Advanced Roadmaps

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set 7h working hours per day in time tracking
 !Screenshot 2020-09-30 at 14.00.42.png|thumbnail! 
 # Set Remaining Time in Jira to 35h. In the Jira issue, it is shown as 1w or 35h, which is fine.
 # In the plan, it should show 5d. But shows 4.375d which translates to 8h per day.
 !Screenshot 2020-09-30 at 14.01.06.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2020-09-30 at 14.01.15.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2020-09-30 at 14.01.30.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
In the plan, it should be shown as 35h or 5d. It should follow the time tracking settings.

h3. Actual Results
In the plan, it translates to 8h per day. It is following the default time tracking settings.


h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Time tracking, working hours per day is not respected by Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, in Jira, you cannot use the *Team* field from Advanced Roadmaps as a statistic type on any Dashboard gadgets nor does it support sorting via JQL (ORDER BY Team ASC).

h3. Proposed solution

Include the *Team* field to Jira's supposed field for sorting and statistic type on gadgets for better reporting.
fields.summary: Team field not supported for sorting or gadgets

fields.description:
At the moment, only number fields are allowed to be used for the estimation on Software boards. 

Suggestions:
* Provide an option list for estimations to allow the end user to simply choose which estimate value to use.
* Allow the end user to choose which options to show on the Estimation drop-down
fields.summary: Allow an option list for the Software board estimates

fields.description:
Recently the burndown chart can show only for one sprint.
The customer needs to see a burndown chart showing the total project which will consist of multiple sprints, which will show the changes throughout one project.
fields.summary: Burndown chart across multiple sprints

fields.description:
*Request:*

Add the ability to extend the csv export capabilities from current fields, all fields to include an option to export project fields when a single project is selected in the query or when multiple projects who use the same screen scheme are included in the query. 

If the projects included in the query do not have the same screen scheme, grey out the project field export capabilities. 

 

*Case*:

In a lot of scenarios the all fields export is extremely excessive and rarely do any issues ever use all the fields in the system if ever.  The current field export is great but setting up the initial saved filter with all the columns can be tedious especially when working in a lot of projects. Providing the ability to export the project fields will cut down on this time on setting up and exporting your data for a specific project.
fields.summary: Extend CSV Export to include project fields option

fields.description:
I can see the progress of an epic by viewing the epic details, but not at a glance. To keep things simple (for me anyway) it would be nice to see in terms of % tasks complete (crude measure available in the epic detail) , or for others actually using time estimates, in terms task effort against total. Perhaps a toggle to o which you want?

Nice if the colour went pale to left as tasks completed? anyway that would really help.
fields.summary: Roadmaps - Visualise epic progress directly in calender view

fields.description:
I have the few queries with regards to the above subject matter
 * Can our Jira cloud instance be customized for its Look n Feel ?
 * The current Look and Feel configuration setting in the JIRA cloud instance is limited to System Logo, Title, Favicon, Navigation colors and Date / time formats
 * Is there an option to have a more professional header, left panel and footer for every page on our JIRA instance which will go with our corporate branding? If so, how can this be done?  
 * In case we are not able to build/configure this level of customization in our Cloud instance then do Atlassian Support or any other group at Atlassian provider service where they do the customization for us?
Please advise and let us know at the earliest
fields.summary: Customizing the Look n Feel of our company's JIRA Cloud instance

fields.description:
Situation:

The user wants the field to be *mandatorily* modified during creation. However, when using an automatic template, Jira considers this to be a change in the field and users can create the issue without having made any changes in the field.
fields.summary: Make the Field has been modified Validator recognize a field template during issue creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Epic child of an *Initiative* did not load the *Initiative* information when we click to back from Epic to the *Initiative* via issue key.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue type "*Initiative*".
 # Access the "*Initiative*".
 # Then add an issue type "*Epic*" under the Initiative as "*Child issue*"
 # Then click on the "*Summary*" of the *Epic*, under the *Initiative*.
 !image-2020-09-28-16-52-53-246.png|width=456,height=356!
 # At this point, we will be on the *Initiative* > *Epic*.
 # Click on the "*Initiative*" key as follows below:
 !screenshot-4.png|width=378,height=75!

h3. Expected Results

We should be redirected to the *Initiative*.
h3. Actual Results

The URL will be updated with "*Initiative*" key, however, the main panel will continue with Epic information.
 !screenshot-5.png|width=703,height=440!
h3. Workaround
 * When we will open the "*Epic*" if we click on the issue key instead of the summary the redirection will work.
fields.summary: The Epic child of an Initiative did not load the Initiative information when we click to back from Epic to the Initiative via issue key.

fields.description:
Let's say I have an epic with many issues and I want to filter them, say by issue type

!image-2020-09-28-17-44-56-149.png!

This is what I get now

!image-2020-09-28-17-46-27-976.png!

and this is what I should get, which would allow me to use Basic / "Simple mode"

!image-2020-09-28-17-48-01-316.png!
fields.summary: "View in search" for Epics should return a simple query

fields.description:
We would like for a notification to be sent if a user is present in the people picker custom field type.  I have tried to find a way to do this through automations but am finding struggles.  Is there a way we can add this functionality similarly to how assignees and reporters receive a message?

 

Example:  We have a custom field called Team Members this utilizes the people picker field type.  When the issue is created or this field is edited we would like an email sent to the user in that field.
fields.summary: Notification for people fields in Team-Managed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the *Epic link* field is required then this value cannot be set for Story issues while being created in the Plan.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a *Field Required Validator* in the create the transition of your Workflow for a Story issue type and publish
 # Create a Story in your Plan under an Epic or while setting the *Parent* field

h3. Expected Results

The Epic link value is already provided thus the validation should pass and the issue should be created.

h3. Actual Results

The validation fails and the issue cannot be created as if there is no Epic link value provided when Advanced Roadmap is supposed to do this automatically when creating a Story under an Epic.

Presumably, this is happening because the workflow validator can't distinguish between the *Parent link* and *Epic link* fields.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available. The Story will have to be created in JIRA and not in your Plan.
fields.summary: Epic link can't be set during creation if the field is required

fields.description:
The child issues show a progress bar with the percentage of the complete work, it would be very helpful to show this information in a report.
 !image-2020-09-24-16-23-51-885.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add a report with the child issue percentage information

fields.description: The "Plan Sprint" is appearing even there is no Confluence linked to the Jira instance. It would be nice to have the ability to remove this button as it is not necessary.
fields.summary: Ability to remove "Plan Sprint" button in Scrum backlog

fields.description:
The velocity chart report has a calculation named commitment, this is the total estimate of all issues in the sprint when it begins.

It would be helpful to have an option in JQL to list issues that were part of a specific sprint when it was started, something like the commitment bar but in JQL.
https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/view-and-understand-the-velocity-chart/
fields.summary: Add an option in JQL to list issues that were part of a specific sprint when it was started

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Dependency changes don't show up in review changes dialog in Advanced Roadmaps
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open advanced roadmaps plan
 # change an issue to have a dependency
 # Open save to Jira dialog

h3. Expected Results

Dependency changes shows in the save dialog when opened
h3. Actual Results

No dependency related changes are shown
h3. Workaround
Create and Edit dependencies from the issue view in Jira
fields.summary: Dependency changes don't show up in review changes dialog in Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
+Imagine this scenario (in Advanced Roadmaps):+
The hierarchy is *Initiative* -> *Feature* -> *Epic*. However, there are cases where there is no *Feature* so the hierarchy could be *Initiative* -> *Epic*.

Please provide the ability to configure any issue type to have multiple hierarchical levels.
fields.summary: Provide the ability (in Advanced Roadmaps) to configure an issue type to have multiple hierarchy levels

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Plan doesn't load when source filter has component condition and the component on search doesn't  exist on  the project being queried.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter like {{project in A,B,C) and component in (empty,  component 1)}}
 # Create a plan based on this filter
#* Plan won't load if the component 1 doesn't exist on all projects (A, B and C)

h3. Expected Results
Plan loads as the query works

h3. Actual Results
Plan is not loaded. Error on console:
{code}TypeError: Cannot read property 'defaultIssuePriorityId' of undefined at le (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/portfolio-3.af6cd997556d950f89dd.8.js:93:2282776) at https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/portfolio-3.af6cd997556d950f89dd.8.js:93:2283662 at Array.map (<anonymous>) at Object.ue (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/portfolio-3.af6cd997556d950f89dd.8.js:93:2283638) at https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/portfolio-3.af6cd997556d950f89dd.8.js:93:1731820 at a (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~31ecd969.898f46526b660f3178d2.8.js:1:9561) at Generator._invoke (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~31ecd969.898f46526b660f3178d2.8.js:1:9314) at Generator.forEach.e.<computed> [as next] (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~31ecd969.898f46526b660f3178d2.8.js:1:9918) at L (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/portfolio-3.af6cd997556d950f89dd.8.js:93:558440) at Object.c [as cont] (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/portfolio-3.af6cd997556d950f89dd.8.js:93:559279){code}

h3. Workaround
Update the filter in order to have component queried only on projects where it exist.
e.g.: project in (A,B) and component in (component 1) or component is empty
fields.summary: Plan doesn't  load when filter has component condition

fields.description:
When doing a JQL search with the team field from advanced roadmaps it converts the name of the team into the ID, it would be helpful to keep the Team name to have better visibility of the JQL.
 !image-2020-09-22-13-46-06-583.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Advanced roadmaps Teams JQL search by name not ID

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The summary view of a Software project is accessible via URL, but not via the project sidebar. When accessing the Summary it says the project type is business.

(!) This only happens in some instances.

This issue brings problems to users that use the Summary as the project home page. There are links missing in the left nav panel, e.g. Boards.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a Software project.
 # Navigate to [https://domain.atlassian.net/projects/pkey/summary].
 ** You will have access to the project's summary page.
 #  See the project type. It is written that the project is Business.

h3. Expected Results

It should say that it is a Software Project.
h3. Actual Results

It says that it is a Business Project
h3. Workaround

There are no workarounds at the moment.
fields.summary: When accessing the summary view of a Software project it says the project type is Business

fields.description:
If you have the backlog enabled in a next-gen board and there are issues there when you disable the backlog, all the issues are moved to the board but if you re-enable the backlog, the issues will remain on the board and you lose the information about issues you had in the backlog. There's no way to recover your backlog.

As a Jira Software user, I want the issues that used to be in the backlog when it was active to be moved back to it when re-enabling the backlog.

Also, the user should be notified that the issues will be moved to the board when disabling the backlog in next-gen projects.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want the issues to be moved back to the backlog when disabling and enabling it

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Right now, the development panel shows only the latest 3 environments where deployments happened. Because of that, when working with more than 3 environments, sometimes important ones are not properly displayed (Production, Staging for example).

h3. Suggestion

Allow the development panel summary to show the name of all environments related to that issue.
fields.summary: Allow Development Panel summary to show more than 3 environments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
REST API endpoint ([Get user default columns|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-3-user-columns-get]) returns incorrect columns with duplicate custom fields

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two Next-gen projects, each having a custom field of the same name, say _Custom01_. Alternatively, create one Next-gen project with its own custom field having the same name as one already existing.
 # Run a JQL search (e.g. _project = <Next-gen project 1>_). Go to *Columns->My Defaults* and ensure the _Custom01_ column is checked. Export the output as XML or CSV (all fields).
 # Execute the Jira REST API endpoint: [Get user default columns|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-3-user-columns-get]

h3. Expected Results
* The _Custom01_ column returned by the Jira REST API endpoint should match the one in the exported XML or CSV file.

h3. Actual Results
* The _Custom01_ column returned by the Jira REST API endpoint may be one or the other duplicated field.

h3. Workaround
Rename one (or more) of the duplicated custom fields so that their names are unique.
fields.summary: REST API endpoint (Get user default columns) returns incorrect columns with duplicate custom fields

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to have a global setting to disable or change the "Hide completed issues older than" from the Kanban boards.
It is hard to manage this option when having 100+ Kanban boards with multiple Done statuses at the workflow.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have a global setting to disable or change the "Hide completed issues older than"from the Kanban boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Advanced Roadmaps is incapable of accurately scheduling future Sprints when running parallel with multiple Teams at once. With multiple Teams running multiple Sprints at once, the scheduler doesn't align the upcoming Sprints unless there's a start/end date added which isn't possible for future Sprints.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create multiple Sprints in JIRA for teams (Team A = A1, A2, A3, Team B = B1, B2, B3, ...)
# Start the first round of Sprints (A1, B1, C1, D1)
# Use the Board as your Issue source
# Create teams based on the Sprints (Team A, Team B, ...) and set sprint duration (e.g. 3 weeks)

h3. Expected Results

When grouping the view settings to Teams, each team is presented with their current active Sprints and upcoming Sprints, following each other chronologically according to the Team's Sprint iteration length and capacity.

h3. Actual Results

All future Sprints are scheduled with the same dates across all teams regardless of the Team's iteration or capacity.

 !TEAM_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

* Create a filter for each team that extracts only the tickets for this team
* Optionally you can create a board in the project for each of these filters which can be convenient for each team to see only their tickets
* Instead of using the project board as the issue source for the plan, create one issue source for each team board
* In the plan, edit each team to associate it with the corresponding issue source

Now the scheduler will be able to plan the work of the different teams in parallel.
fields.summary: Parallel Sprints scheduling with multiple teams

fields.description:
This feature request is to add the ability to search for the "tasks" field, which exists in Bitbucket Cloud's Pull requests, on Jira through a JQL, as described here for other fields:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/advanced-searching-development-fields-reference-973491363.html
fields.summary: JQL for Bitbucket Pull request tasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Resolution field is not visible in the view screen in the Jira new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Open screen configuration for a project:
_Open project > Project settings > Screens_
* Add "Resolution" field to the project's View screen configuration
* View a project issue via new issue view

h3. Expected Results
Resolution field should be displayed in the issue view.

h3. Actual Results
Resolution field is not visible in the issue view

h3. Workaround
Use the Jira old issue view.
fields.summary: Resolution field is not visible in the view screen in the Jira new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Status filter on a NextGen Roadmap has only 3 statuses to filter for:
 * To Do
 * In Progress
 * Done

These are not actually the names of the columns on the board, but rather status categories. It is confusing for customers who have custom columns apart from those 3. If there are only the factory default columns, those match the filter perfectly. However, if customer creates custom columns, the logic changes to:
 * The left most column referred as To Do, but it can have any names
 * All columns excluding left and right most referred as In Progress, but there can be differently named column(s), all will be displayed. For example if there is a To Do column here, that status will be displayed too, but the filter is for In Progress.
 * The right most column referred as Done, but it can be called anything.

An Epic is displayed if the Epic itself or at least one of its children has the filtered status, or in case of custom columns, the filtered statuses by In Progress.

It would be good to have it documented somewhere, that the Status filter has nothing to do with the column names in a NextGen project, except if there are no custom columns at all.
fields.summary: Logic behind Status filter for NextGen Roadmap is not documented well

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"+" icon on *Reviewers* option under development panel in new issue view doesn’t work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From BitBucket create a pull request and add more than 3 reviewers 
 # In Jira issue, click on the pull request under development panel and try to view the addition reviewers. 

h3. Expected Results
Users list should be visible

h3. Actual Results

It throws up an error “Something’s gone wrong” and the development panel is not accessible without a reload. 

h3. Workaround

View the additional *reviewers* in the old issue view.
fields.summary: Reviewers option doesn't work in new issue view under development panel.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to open the plugin data from roadmap. It returns the empty page:

 !image-2020-09-17-23-25-34-485.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Next gen project and access the roadmap

 !image-2020-09-17-23-25-53-636.png|thumbnail! 

 # Open any of the epic and navigate to the addon
 # It returns the empty page

 !image-2020-09-17-23-26-06-134.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results
# It should return the addon data

h3. Actual Results
# it returns the empty page


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accessing addon from roadmap returns empty page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Burnup Chart calculates the *Completed work* and *Work scope* based on the story points when issues are added to the sprint, completed (transitioned to a status mapped to the last columns), and reopened (transitioned to a status not mapped to the last column).

Currently, if an issue is already on a status mapped to the last column before the sprints starts, and it is added to the sprint, and then reopened, the report will not decrease the completed work, and will sum up the issue's story points to the work scope again.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Here's an example I made that shows how to replicate the problem:
* Created Sprint *Moe sprint*;
* Created 3 issues;
** *BAS-2088* with 10 story points
** *BAS-2087* with 10 story points
** *BAS-2089* with 10 story points
* Added BAS-2088 and BAS-2087 to the sprint;
* Configured the board columns so the status *IN REVIEW* is at the last column;
* Transitioned *BAS-2089 to* *IN REVIEW*;
* Started sprint;
** First event logged in the report
 !Screen Shot 2020-09-17 at 09.12.47.png|thumbnail! 
* Added BAS-2089 to the sprint:
** Event logged in the report. Increasing Completed work and Work scope
  !Screen Shot 2020-09-17 at 09.13.59.png|thumbnail! 
* Transitioned BAS-2089 to *IN PROGRESS*
** Event logged in the report. Completed work remained the same (x), Work scope increased (x):
 !Screen Shot 2020-09-17 at 09.15.43.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

When reopening *BAS-2089*, the *Completed work* should have been decreased (in that case, to 0). And the *Work scope* should have remained the same.

h3. Actual Results

*Completed work* remained the same, and the *Work scope* was increased again, summed up by the current amount of story points in the issue. 

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Burnup Chart calculates completed work and work scope incorrectly for issues transitioned to final statuses before the sprint start and then added to the sprint after it

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Since the introduction of the new improved interface in Advanced Roadmaps, [stages and skills|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/configuring-stages-and-skills-998651413.html] has been deprecated amongst other features.

h3. Proposed solution

Some teams still depend on different skills for their teams. Re-introducing skills to Advanced Roadmaps would allow these teams to use skills as part of the scheduling.
fields.summary: Restoring the stages and skills functionality

fields.description:
When we try to add the columns on the search page, only a limited number of fields are displayed, and they are arranged in ABC (alphabetical) order.
 !スクリーンショット 2020-09-17 13.50.50.png|thumbnail! 
Every time we'd like to add a particular field to a column, we have to search for it. This process is annoying.

I think it would be better that the customer can decide which field to display.
fields.summary: All fields are not displayed when we try to add the columns on the search page

fields.description:
My Project - [https://fortressinfosec.atlassian.net/jira/software/projects/FPTP/boards/80]

 

So I understand that the NextGen template is an attempt to have quicker and cleaner project workflows but some basic features needed in any projects are not even here.  And I noticed people have been complaining for a while with no one paying attention.  You basically release a blank page and forced me to do more manual work.  Now ignoring the bigger features and options keeping in mind a slim down version.  Here are the very basics your missing.

Mandatory fields-  Come on guys so no fields are mandatory?  So now i have to track over 60 tickets to make sure everyone is adding their details.  I cant even create a new fields to force condition because it does not even show up.

 

Custom Fields-  This is basically an expanded version of mandatory fields.  Same issues

 

Workflow changes-  apparently you changed this for rules but the rules do nothing for controlling the process on triggers actions based on events

 

There are a bunch more but keeping it simple.  I will tell you the truth.  My company has started looking to smartsheets  and clickup
fields.summary: Simple straight forward features no functioning

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Linking Confluence pages directly on our issues is an amazing feature that we can use for documentation subjects, or even link some articles that were used to assist on that determined reason - it is a feature with many different business cases!
When we try to link a Confluence page that is actually the overview of a space, though, this doesn't work as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any of your issues on JIRA;
# Click on the + button to add a Confluence page;
# Either search or enter the link of an overview page, like {{https://SITENAME.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/overview}}
# Press enter and then click on *Link*.

h3. Expected Results
The page is linked, as expected.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA throws an error with this statement:
"_We're having trouble. Check your connection and try again._"
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:

*Notes*:
* After hitting on *Link*, the browser receives a request with 400 status on this endpoint:
{{https://SITENAME.atlassian.net/rest/confluenceIssueLink/1/confluence?issueId=10045&pageUrl=https://SITENAME.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/overview}}
* Perhaps JIRA is set to expect {{wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/pages/CONTENTID}} instead of {{/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/overview}} and that is causing the issue (?)
* It only happens for 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot link issue to Confluence page if it is a native overview page of a space

fields.description:
Like that we can let others edit filters if we want to do that. I have normally 1 person I want to allow to edit filters I have created. The following would be nice to be able to have:

1)  Set in user profile an always set user for editing, like we have for sharing filters where we can set who can automatically see newly created filters.

2)  Mass edit the permissions for editing.

3)  When filter is copied the editing permissions is also copied. 

For releases I create about 25 to 30 filters each time and right now I don't go and add someone to edit only because it is time consuming to edit permissions on every filter.  Normally I copy from another so the copy from one to the other would be nice but if you know you always want a certain person or group to be able to edit it would be nice to be able to have that as a default in your user settings.

Mass edit would be nice so if you want to put someone on to edit ones you created a while back but they may need to edit you could do that easily.
fields.summary: Filter Edit Permissions Improvements

fields.description:
Provide more granular control for the custom fields over a particular status.

For example: Ability to make a custom field as _*required*_ on a particular status. 
Also, this ability should be independent of the workflow transition properties.
fields.summary: Provide more granular control for the custom fields.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# On the backlog of a Next Gen project, create an issue with a really long summary.
# In the Next Gen Board, ensure that there are more than 3 columns.
# Create a few sub-tasks in the issue and start a sprint.
# Back in the board view, group by subtask.

h3. Current Result
The issue summary is cut short beyond 3 columns.
 !image-2020-09-16-11-20-15-724.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result
The issue summary should either wrap to show the entire summary or span across the space left along the other columns.
 !image-2020-09-16-11-21-39-600.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: On a Team Managed Board the issue summary gets stripped off when the grouping is by sub-tasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Epics should disappear from the epic panel when either:
 # the epic itself is not complete
 # OR there are visible issues belonging to the epic. 
(For example, let's say an epic is marked as done but the last incomplete issue of the epic is in the active sprint.
 ## Change the issue to be done. The epic will still be visible in the epic panel as the issue is still visible.
 ## Complete the sprint. This will make the last issue in the epic disappear. The epic should then disappear from the epic panel.

For some backlogs, we have a problem where the epic does not disappear from the epic panel when the epic has issues in multiple done statuses.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create at least 2 issues in the epic on your team-managed backlog in the active sprint.
 ## Create an epic using epic panel
 ## Select the epic using the epic panel
 ## Create 2 issues in an active sprint: Issue A and Issue B
 # Configure your board to have 2 statuses in the Done status category.
 ## Navigate to Project settings > Columns and statuses screen.
 ## Click "Manage workflow" button and then "Edit workflow" to open the Workflow editor.
 ## Create another Done status and name the new status "Abandoned". There should be 2 status in the done status category - "DONE" and "ABANDONED".
 ## Save your changes. Make sure the columns on your board view have "ABANDONED" as the right-most column.
!image-2021-10-26-15-26-27-655.png!
 # Update Issue A and B to be in "ABANDONED" status, and the epic to be in "DONE" status.
 # Complete the Sprint to make Issue A and Issue B disappear. The epic will disappear too.
 # Update Issue A to be in "DONE" status. Keep issue B to be in "ABANDONED" status.
!image-2021-10-26-15-43-30-102.png!
 # Navigate back to the backlog and see the epic still in the epic panel, but Issue A and Issue B are not visible.

!image-2021-10-26-15-45-20-714.png!
h3. Expected Results

The done epic should be gone from the epic panel. 
h3. Actual Results

The done epic still showing on the epic panel. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Marking the epic as done in the team-managed (formerly next-gen) backlog does not remove the epic from the epic panel when the epic contains issues with multiple done statuses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When opening the "Create Branch" link in a new tab from the board side panel in the old issue view, a new tab of the board is open instead of the Create Branch screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Video:*  [^Screen Recording 2020-09-15 at 06.03 PM.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results

The Create Branch screen will open

h3. Actual Results

A new tab is open with the Board.

h3. Workaround

Enable the new issue view.
fields.summary: When opening the "Create Branch" link in a new tab from the board side panel, a new tab of the board is open

fields.description:
In Advanced Roadmaps, when you select the start date of a release as "As early as possible" and end date as "After all issues are completed", the timeline doesn't show the dates of the release.

In Portfolio 2.0, you could see the release regardless of whether it was fixed or dynamic, and when dynamic it would always be green but could at least easily tell when that date is set to.

Having this visible helps to understand and easily identify when the release should be completed.
fields.summary: As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to see the release start and end dates in the timeline when using dynamic dates

fields.description:
As a architecture role user I have visibility for long list of project. I would like to go to "projects" view, click star-icon on header and get the list sorted so that my favourite one's are on top of the list.

Currently all other columns can be used for sorting except star and type. Currently type sorting not seen that useful.
fields.summary: Project list sorting by favorite

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user trying to change the name of a default issue link type, for some reason, after a while, it creates a new link type with the same default name. 
For example: If you rename the default link type from "Blocks" to "Block", after a while Jira will create a new link type called "Blocks".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Jira > Settings > Issues > Issue Linking
 # Rename the "Blocks" to "Block"
NOTE: It can take more than 1 month to recreate the "Blocks"

h3. Expected Results
As Jira provides the option to rename it, it should work and not recreate the default one.

h3. Actual Results

The default link type is being recreated. 

h3. Workaround

Not change or delete the default link type.
fields.summary: Can't change default link type as it is recreated after a while

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Duplicate Sprints are displayed in Sprint selector:

!Screenshot 2020-09-15 at 12.11.33 PM.png|width=220,height=147!
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Navigate to any Board (next-gen or classic board).
 2) Close current sprint and use the dialog that appears to create the next sprint
 3) Without refreshing the page, open an issue in the new board and click the sprint dropdown
h3. Expected Results

One active sprint entry should be displayed
h3. Actual Results

Duplicate entry for the same active sprint is displayed
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Duplicate Sprints are displayed in Sprint selector

fields.description:
Sometimes customers need a report where they can check usage stats like for example.
- Which teams, groups, or users are using Jira in a usage percentage
- Are there inactive boards?
- Collaboration stats
- Most worked projects, etc
fields.summary: Add a Jira usage Report

fields.description: Every time I view the roadmap I have to apply the right filters to get the view I want, which is to say I do not want to see completed epics on the roadmap.  It would be great to have a default filter by status, date, or other criteria (label, etc).  This relates to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17799, which is to have a customizable timeline.
fields.summary: Next Gen Roadmap - Default filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to add new users as Jira software board administrator via board settings.



+*Error*+:
 _"Ug" is not a valid user._
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Invite a new user to the Jira cloud instance.
 * Try to add the new user as a board admin in any Jira software board

h3. Expected Results

The new user should be added successfully to the board administrators field.
h3. Actual Results

The following error message is seen upon adding the new user:

!Screenshot 2020-09-11 at 5.08.40 PM.png|width=220,height=88!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to add new users as Jira software board admin via board settings. Error: "Ug" is not a valid user
